channel.title: CVE Feed for mailerlite -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for mailerlite -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-33201|2024-08-03T08:01:20.311Z -- mailerlite -- mailerlite%20%28wordpress%20plugin%29
item.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in MailerLite – Signup forms (official) plugin <= 1.5.7 at WordPress allows an attacker to change the API key.

item.title: CVE-2023-52223|2024-08-02T22:55:41.393Z -- mailerlite -- mailerlite%20%E2%80%93%20woocommerce%20integration
item.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in MailerLite MailerLite – WooCommerce integration.This issue affects MailerLite – WooCommerce integration: from n/a through 2.0.8.

item.title: CVE-2023-52227|2024-08-02T22:55:41.699Z -- mailerlite -- mailerlite%20%E2%80%93%20woocommerce%20integration
item.description: Missing Authorization vulnerability in MailerLite MailerLite – WooCommerce integration.This issue affects MailerLite – WooCommerce integration: from n/a through 2.0.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-1386|2024-08-01T18:40:20.436Z -- mailerlite -- mailerlite%20%E2%80%93%20signup%20forms%20%28official%29
item.description: The MailerLite – Signup forms (official) plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's shortcode(s) in versions 1.5.0 to 1.7.6 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2023-52223|2024-02-28T16:37:20.400Z -- mailerlite -- mailerlite%20%E2%80%93%20woocommerce%20integration
item.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in MailerLite MailerLite – WooCommerce integration.This issue affects MailerLite – WooCommerce integration: from n/a through 2.0.8.

item.title: CVE-2023-52227|2024-06-11T20:24:09.422Z -- mailerlite -- mailerlite%20%E2%80%93%20woocommerce%20integration
item.description: Missing Authorization vulnerability in MailerLite MailerLite – WooCommerce integration.This issue affects MailerLite – WooCommerce integration: from n/a through 2.0.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-1386|2024-05-02T16:52:17.385Z -- mailerlite -- mailerlite%20%E2%80%93%20signup%20forms%20%28official%29
item.description: The MailerLite – Signup forms (official) plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's shortcode(s) in versions 1.5.0 to 1.7.6 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-2797|2024-06-04T17:29:40.590Z -- mailerlite -- mailerlite%20%E2%80%93%20signup%20forms%20%28official%29
item.description: The MailerLite – Signup forms (official) plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized plugin setting changes due to a missing capability check on the toggleRolesAndPermissions and editAllowedRolesAndPermissions functions in all versions up to, and including, 1.7.6. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to allow lower level users to modify forms.

item.title: CVE-2024-1386|2024-07-07T13:53:03.431Z -- mailerlite -- mailerlite%20%E2%80%93%20signup%20forms%20%28official%29
item.description: The MailerLite – Signup forms (official) plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's shortcode(s) in versions 1.5.0 to 1.7.6 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-2797|2024-08-01T19:25:41.709Z -- mailerlite -- mailerlite%20%E2%80%93%20signup%20forms%20%28official%29
item.description: The MailerLite – Signup forms (official) plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized plugin setting changes due to a missing capability check on the toggleRolesAndPermissions and editAllowedRolesAndPermissions functions in all versions up to, and including, 1.7.6. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to allow lower level users to modify forms.
